objects.name: DesktopControls
objects.string:
CONTROLS:

- Up to pedal forward
- Down to pedal back
- Space to brake
- Left/Right to rotate

Esc to reset scene.

content.text:
CONTROLS:

- Up to pedal forward
- Down to pedal back
- Space to brake
- Left/Right to rotate

Esc to reset scene.

objects.name: GameInstructions
objects.string:
Ride the bike to the finish and see if you can beat 30 seconds!

Force must not exceed 1,000 and you must not land on your head or you will crash!

content.text:
Ride the bike to the finish and see if you can beat 30 seconds!

Force must not exceed 1,000 and you must not land on your head or you will crash!

events.comment: Setup scene variables and position mobile buttons relative to scene width.
If we are not on a mobile device then hide the controls, and if we are then Fullscreen!
Bike Physics
RagDoll
Move Front suspension and crank to match physics.
Update force text
update force indicator, change colour and length based on how much force was applied.
On a mobile device use vibration to give feedback when we feel forces.
Unattach RagDoll from Bike
Restrain Ragdoll joints
Unattach RagDoll from Bike
Restrain Ragdoll joints
Set Accel variable to 0 to detect if we get any pedal input
Pedalling Forward?
As soon as we first go forward, hide the instructions.
Pedalling Backward?
This fires if you're not accelerating - Slows you down slowly (Freewheel)
Brake
Handle Bike Rotation
Now change the rear wheel motor speed to the value of the scene variable (bikeSpeed) we have modified with our input.
Reset the scene if we press Esc.
Find how high above the ground we are?  and zoom camera in/out depending on height.
Smooth follow camera
Slowly scroll mountain background layer.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.
